questions.question: How long have purple frogs been around?
questions.explanation: Purple frogs have been around for about 130 million years - that's since the time of the dinosaurs! They're sometimes called 'living fossils.'

questions.question: What can you see through a glass frog's belly?
questions.explanation: Glass frogs have transparent skin on their belly, and you can see their heart, liver, and intestines! It's like having a window into their body.

questions.question: What amazing ability do axolotls have?
options: They can change colors like chameleons
questions.explanation: Axolotls can regrow almost any body part, including their legs, heart, and even parts of their brain! Scientists study them to learn about healing.

questions.question: Are all toads frogs?
options: Yes! Toad is just a name for frogs with dry, bumpy skin
questions.explanation: All toads are frogs! 'Toad' is just a common name for frogs that have dry, bumpy skin. Scientists group them all together as 'anurans.'

questions.question: Where is the only place wild axolotls live?
questions.explanation: Wild axolotls only live in Lake Xochimilco in Mexico City. The Aztec people named them after their god Xolotl!
